organization.name: Skycool Systems
organization.problem: Air conditioning and refrigeration systems consume close to 25% of electricity generated worldwide and are responsible for 7% of global greenhouse gas emissions.
organization.solution: SkyCool's vision is to improve the efficiency of all cooling systems by harnessing an untapped renewable resource: the sky. Our core innovation is a radiative cooling material that we've combined with a panel system to improve the efficiency of any vapor-compression based cooling system, saving our customers money and preventing the emissions of CO2 and other harmful greenhouse gases.
organization.team: Skycool Systems has a dedicated team of 14 employees working towards a sustainable and energy-efficient future.
organization.geographic: Skycool Systems operates in Mountain View, California, United States, and contributes to reducing energy consumption and greenhouse gas emissions globally.
misc: SkyCool Panels passively cool fluids in air conditioning and refrigeration systems. Our panels are designed to connect into new and legacy cooling systems with minimal risk to the underlying system operation. Our panels achieve energy savings between 15% – 40% as a function of the application and number of panels deployed.

organization.name: Membrion
organization.problem: We need to efficiently recycle wastewater.
organization.solution: Membrion manufactures ceramic desalination membranes that can recover up to 98% of water in the harshest conditions. Membrion's flexible, electro-ceramic desalination membranes yield endless possibilities for water recovery, allowing manufacturers to recycle water at previously inaccessible pH ranges and with challenging trace chemicals. The membranes that Membrion creates are low fouling, require less cleaning, are oxidizer resistant, have ultra-low pH stability, and are economical.
organization.team: Membrion boasts a team of 29 employees dedicated to revolutionizing wastewater recycling using advanced ceramic membrane technology.
organization.geographic: Membrion is headquartered in Seattle, Washington, United States, and addresses the global need for efficient wastewater recycling and water recovery solutions.
misc: By using one of the world's most abundant natural materials—silica—we've created the world's first ceramic desalination membrane that combines the long life and performance advantages of ceramic membranes with the roll-to-roll processing that makes polymer desalination membranes so economical.

organization.name: Matter
organization.problem: Matter's mission is to improve the health of our world and its water by capturing microplastics and stopping this pollution from choking our planet and threatening our eco-systems.
organization.solution: Matter is an innovation company pioneering technology solutions for capturing, harvesting and recycling microplastics. Matter works alongside industry to integrate our patented microplastic filtration technology into domestic and commercial washing machines.
organization.team: Matter is committed to its mission with a dedicated team focused on environmental sustainability and microplastic pollution solutions.
organization.geographic: Matter is located in Bristol, United Kingdom, and works towards improving global environmental health by preventing microplastic pollution in waterways.
misc: We are very proud of our filtration technology that captures microplastic, preventing it from entering waterways and polluting the natural environment. But our work doesn't stop there. Harvesting and recycling that microplastic is the next step and we're on a mission to keep this resource out of landfill and incinerators and find solutions for it to be fed back into manufacturing and support a circular economy.

organization.name: Advanced Ionics
organization.problem: Green hydrogen is a powerful vision. It's a global necessity to beat back climate change. But let's be honest: it's too expensive. Green hydrogen production costs many times more than its dirty uncle today, and creates exactly the same product.
organization.solution: At Advanced Ionics, we've created a green hydrogen platform that allows industrial hydrogen producers and users to achieve sustainability, without sacrificing profit. We combine our breakthrough electrolyzer technology with onsite process and waste heat from industrial sites to produce green hydrogen for less than a dollar per kilogram.
organization.team: Advanced Ionics is driven by a team of 11 professionals dedicated to making green hydrogen production economically viable.
organization.geographic: Advanced Ionics operates in Milwaukee, Wisconsin, United States, and offers a sustainable solution for green hydrogen production.
misc: Our Symbiotic™ Electrolyzers use process or waste heat across a wide temperature range—from 100 °C up to as hot as you can get it. By operating with steam, our electrolyzers tap into excess heat that is already available in industrial settings, lowering electricity use in tandem, usually below 35 kWh/kg, with 30 kWh/kg possible. And what's more, our technology uses abundant and widely available components to keep capital costs low – no expensive platinum-group metals, no iridium, no fluoropolymer membranes.

organization.name: Sapphire Technologies
organization.problem: Companies need to make meaningful progress toward their environmental, social and governance (ESG) goals, while demonstrating strong financial returns.
organization.solution: Our team of experts develops and manufactures energy recovery systems that harness the power of gas expansion to produce reliable and clean electricity. By recovering this wasted pressure energy, we help customers maximize efficiencies, improve productivity, reduce carbon emissions, offset electrical costs and achieve substantial financial returns.
organization.team: Sapphire Technologies is driven by an expert team of 18 individuals committed to advancing clean energy solutions.
organization.geographic: Sapphire Technologies is based in Cerritos, California, United States, and contributes to the development of clean and efficient energy solutions worldwide.
misc: The FreeSpin® In-line Turboexpander uses zero fuel and produces zero emissions. The simplicity of the FIT design enables a cost-effective solution for power generation.
